column5:
I'm 25F and get on better with guys. In fact, I find it hard to be good friends with females. I feel more chill around guys, no drama. Maybe it was because all the girls I knew were top busy having kids, relationship issues or other drama. Whilst the guys just wanted to chill and play games. 

I'd love a girly bestie to talk about stuff too. But it just seems to fizzle away. My best friend is a guy so...I dunno.
What's that blinking light on the side of their car?
I rented a number of rooms. In multiple room houses, the larger rooms are more expensive, or if there are two of you such as a couple living in one room then it's a higher rate.
It was. It was via messages and I put screen shots of the conversation in there. You obviously missed it.
I can't stand when people say the baby has the dad's eyes or looks like the mum. It's 4 hours old. It looks like a sack of mushy skin that cries and shits.
Kid looks like he's about to burst into tears at the end.

Worked in retail for years. I hated customers like this! They always said I'll only be a minute and take forever. Then say I bet you can't wait to get home....yes Susan. I would have been ten minutes ago when we closed but HERE WE ARE.
It's was all about the wet paper towels for my school haha!
And in the UK you are.
Oh I know, but my manager says it's because they can't find cover. Which isn't my problem. It's also not in my contract to do so, which I'm going to bring up next time I talk to her.
Now lifeless.
Why say sorry when you don't mean it and don't know what for. Saying it without meaning is worse than not saying it.
Get him to clean it. Then throw it away and get him to buy a new one. Why the fuck would you put food in a microwave that's had shit in it??
You have complete creative control over your favourite game and movie. What do you change and why.
And the child.

That was the worst documentary! It leaves out vital facts, like the mysterious man seen with a child was identified and debunked, panders to the parents because anything that doesn't add up to their story they sue over. I highly recommend watching any other documentary than the Netflix one. Then you'll see why.
UK.
Why are you letting her stay there free of charge AND buying her stuff? Tell her to get a job, do something with her life or get out. You're making a mug of yourself.
I was always told that they thought we couldn't hunt for ourselves so we're bringing us animals to feed us and not really gifts.

I haven't spoken to any of my dad's family for 8 years now. Apart from my step mum getting my number and calling me every name under the sun because I got married and didn't tell any of them. 
I'm not going to go into why as it's such a long story, but to cut it short I was painted as the bad guy when I did nothing wrong and my dad twisted everyone's views against me. I tried to sort it out and none of the listened so fuck them. Let them think what they want. 
Looking back at Mt relationships I had the typical daddy issues, looking for love with older men, rushing into relationships, going psycho when they leave etc.

My MIL doesn't even know her son married me. I have no idea what she will do when she finds out and frankly I don't care. 

You say getting married is probably a least a year away, so you have time to maybe test the water and see how the relationship progresses before making a concrete decision on the matter.
Looks like something out of Star Wars

We had snapping turtles back in uni when I studied animal science. The husbandry teacher emphasized how much we need to use the long tongs to feed him. When someone asked why he showed us the tip of his pinky finger was missing.
Don't worry, it's just a flesh wound.
And I don't blame her.
Saves you the trouble of telling everyone. I thought when you get engaged you WANT to tell everyone? You're definitely the AH.
YTA. You didn't ask if it was okay to propose ON THEIR special day. Not the time or place.

Do not let that woman anywhere near your child, husband or you! Yes definitely file charges and get a restraining order! I really hope your baby, you and your husband are okay.
Also you should get a paternity test done and send the results to her alongside the restraining order. Just to rub it in.

Not everyone does. Some people think meh this is my life, others change it or even enjoy it. I once new a guy who worked in the same place for 20+ years and said he often cries because he hates it so much. Yet he still works there. I don't get it. But some people like their 9-5. 
I never understood how people could be happy with being born, educated, get a job to pay other people so they can live, maybe have kids, if you're lucky have a few years retirement then die. How can you not want to do something more with your life? I'm 25, in debt, moved 9 times in 3 years and had 5+ jobs in those 3 years.
But now I have a job I love and pays well, I'm slowly paying off debts and plan to start saving for a house of my own. I don't want kids so don't have to worry about that and I find pleasure is the little things in life. But I still find life mundane and struggle to see the point in life or why I'm here. Guess I just...am?
My mum loves sloths and I can see why she thinks they are cute. But this video always gives me the heebyjeebys! It's so weird! I might send it to her...

One of my boys scared the life out of me a few months back. I heard a thump from that cage, out of the corner of my eye I saw something fall. I see the shape of a rat on the bottom of the cage, he has fallen off of a platform and slammed into the floor. I screamed for my husband, just about to burst into tears. I go to touch him and he jumps up like nothing was wrong. Luckily he hasn't done it again. God damn Squeakers!
It reminds me of those plastic strings we had back in school, Scoobies I think they were called? I could only make the spiral pattern and never got my head around the square one. Man I miss those.

THANK YOU! I'm so suppried they said no even after my diagnosis and mental health. So instead I've got to take birth control until the menopause gives me peace of mind. Not looking forward to that but hey.

As she thanked the cousin for everything, maybe he helped her escape? He may have set something up so she could go somewhere, have the baby safely and live the rest of her life. Or maybe it was a case of him getting her pregnant and found someone who said they would take the baby as payment and in return, look after her?

I've been asking doctors for years. Each of them say no, I'm too young. I'm 25. They said when I'm 30 they may consider it. I told them my husband and I do not want kids and I have serious mental health issues, they still deny me. It sucks.
I enjoyed it. Watched it twice now. The first time it confused me, the second watch I enjoyed it more. The photos gave me the creeps!
People think it's weird that we put pineapple on pizza, but forgot some people put FISH on their. Wtf?
My understanding is teeth aren't supposed to be pure white anyway? I've tried some whitening gel/pen thing on and off for a few months. I don't really see a difference plus it tastes so bad.
The same with gender reveal parties imo. It's like hey we are reproducing! Give us stuff so we don't have to buy it! Because kids are expensive.

NTA. Your mother needs help and therapy. Contact a GP and tell them your concerns. I understand that losing a child is hard, but she must remember here others are still there and you all need each other. Wishing you and your family the best.
NTA it's his kid as well. He doesn't need to be thanked he should be doing it because you know...it's his kid as well?
There are apparently only two accents, super British or Victorian London.
My sex drive is in the minus numbers. It really sucks :'(
NTA she presumed you'd let her have the dress without formally asking you.

Bundy Bundy Bundy. A lot of people have asked me to cover him on my channel and I'm really reluctant to do so. Mostly because I know I will end up going on a rant about how I'm sick of seeing people go all uwu over him and calling themselves a 'fan' of his. 

I spoke to a woman who had photos of him in her house, nearly a shrine, another who named her kid after him. I told them both it was so disrespectful and I'm sure they'd feel differently about them if a loved one was killed by them. But of course they didn't care.

I constantly see people on Facebook ask what local takeaways are open? Does anyone have a number for a taxi? What time does such and such open? 
Apparently writing out a huge Facebook post asking for something and explaining why they need it is easier than googling it. I don't get it.

I have an app on my phone that automatically blocks known spam callers, or comes up with a warning that someone else has reported it as spam. I don't answer unless the spam warning doesn't come up and I'm expecting a call. Other than that, I ignore it. If it's that important they will leave a voicemail or email/text me after saying who they or the company was and that they tried to contact me.

He understands my feelings towards her. He trys not to mention her but I guess sometimes he forgets? If he does I tend to change the subject. It's usually when he talks about stuff he's done rather than her specifically. I wish I was okay with her but after all that's happened, I don't think I want to.
Oh trust me, if she ever shows up at our place I'm immediately calling the police. Luckily she hasn't got my number, dodged a huge bullet there!
Tbh I wouldn't put it past her.

I did a whole documentary on her and looked at the autopsy files. Yes she wasn't taking some of he medication, but some tablets were on a take when needed basis, not daily. So she was missing some of them. There are theories ranging from murder, suicide, an invisibly cloak theory and a theory she was used to spread TB. Ultimately, I think it was either murder (which to me makes more sense after looking into it all) or unintentional suicide...so an accident I guess? I'm thinking maybe she met up with someone she met online and something happened on the roof. John Lordan did a fantastic series on her case and gave me some of the files he had sourced. He looks at the footage, the autopsy, her social media etc. Highly recommended!
Man that's a weight off of my shoulders, thank you!
Thank you ❤️

The Elisa Lam footage has been explained. It's slowed down and chunks are missing. There is nothing supernatural there. Watch it at normal speed and she's probably just messing around with someone or trying to hide to make them jump. Then someone out of frame tells her to stop and she talks to them with arm movements.

Especially when it's in a shop or public. The parents zone out, but all of us poor sods have to listen to it. I also find it cringey when parents try to tell their kids off in public and they just don't listen or they answer them back. 
My sister was a troubled kid. If she started making a scene or crying, mum used to walk out the shop and find somewhere quiet  until she'd stopped, rather than keep wandering around the shop s everyone can hear her.

I never said they killed her. But there are so many questions. How come the two young twins never woke up during the whole thing? I've never heard of that happening. The cadaver dogs I'm not sure on How comes when the police told them not to mention her eye because it could put her in danger, they then mentioned it in the next press appearance? They refused to take a is detector test and were annoyed they were suspects? I get it, but surely you'd say okay I get it, just do what you gotta do to rule me out then find my kid.  Don't fight it. 

No there is no way to react, but after studying true crime for years, you pick up on things like people's behaviour. If you're interested in the case I highly recommend Stephanie Harlowe's videos, I'll link it below. I do plan to cover the case one day but it's a big one. I guess I'm also bitter because no other missing child in history has had as much media attention or money given to them. Yet the parents don't seem too thankful for it compared to others. They left her alone, as did the other parents. If that was in the UK, wouldn't they have faced child endangerment charges or something? They also left the apartment unlocked! It's a mistake they have to deal with. 

https://youtu.be/u0iQuIUhTGI

I hated the Netflix documentary. It's so one sided, they left out loads of stuff. They kept talking about the unidentified man who was identified for one thing. I watched it and thought wow, that was a huge waste of my time and wouldn't recommend it to anyone!

I think she's dead and I think the father knows more than he lets on. I honestly hate him. His body language, his argumentative personality. He doesn't seem thankful at all that we are giving him millions to look for a kid then went missing because they left her unattended in another country. I'm so suppried they haven't been charged with anything just for leaving them alone. A stupid mistake that we are paying for. 

And as for the mother, she talks about Maddie's perfect genitals in her book wtf is all that about? She's just s stubborn as her husband. If they had bugged their house like they did Mick Philpott, I'm pretty sure some questionable stuff would have been said. 

But anyway, it's about Maddie. An innocent little girl who was left unsupervised with her siblings. She's never going to be found and we will never know what happened, unless a death bed confession comes out.

100% NTA. I don't want kids, but even if I did I would never want anyone apart from my Husband there. In fact the last person I'd want looking at my junk is my MIL. 

I hope you and baby are doing okay now. Hopefully one day they will both realise how much they upset you and put you and baby in danger.
I feel the same was about the McCann family. I can't think of any missing child case that got that much exposure as them.
I recently found out my friend stayed with a couple years ago. Turns out she was fucking the dad behind the wife's back to pay her rent. It's probably a really common and gross thing.

I made a video on him a while back. There is so much more to the story and it just gets stranger. The saddest part of, none of this was what SHE wanted and he got away with it. I'm glad she can rest in peace now... but can you really after someone did all he did to her body?
I used to work in a place that printed and embroidered clothing. Was pretty cool to watch and so satisfying watching a big design get filled in with thread with the embroidery.
I wasted £10k in 1 year. Well, aside from a car, lessons, driving test and tattoos.
THANK YOU! I've left so many groups because if those kinds of people. One of them told me they names their kid after Ted Bundy. Fruitcake.

My husband proposed with his grandmother's ring. It's really not my style at all, but I liked it because it was something personal. I don't wear it now because it's too big and clunky. So I just wear my wedding ring.
It can't be, he's still got his clothes on.
Yeah I realized that after I posted. I can't edit it now.
Awesome name!

One of my boys scared the life out of me when he fell off a level and landed hard on the one below. He didn't move and I screamed for my husband, I thought he was dead! I opened the cage door and he still didn't move. As soon as I got closer, he woke up and was like oh hi! Any food?
Never knew they could sleep so deep 😅
I've debunked that whole case. They weren't missing they made a mistake in saying so. It is an accident, but the family cannot accept it.
Yay! Thank you!

Imagine if he dropped it whilst taking it out. Major oops.

Looks so good! I'd say add some levels maybe? I have two wooden magazine holders glued together and holes in them so my hamster can use them as levels. Or something hanging from the top but really low?
The ones with UV lights in/on are fine. They decontaminate it.

He reminds me of the whacky TNT dog from crash bandicoot.
NTA. I'm lactose intolerant and my husband constantly eat chocolate, like daily and always offers me some. Oh I'm also on a diet but that goes through his head as well.
Just because someone is getting married doesn't mean you have to go.
She was drunk, wandered into a freezer and died. That's it, I don't understand why people can't accept that?
